TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr PERSON PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

The applicant is the father of the child S. , born out of wedlock on CARDINAL DATE . He had been living with Ms B .- K. , the child ’s mother , from DATE to DATE . After their separation PERSON lived with his mother . The applicant had contacts with PERSON until DATE , when Ms GPE prohibited further visits . He subsequently instituted numerous court proceedings concerning access to and custody of his son .

The applicant ’s repeated motions to be granted access to S. by a court order were to no avail . DATE until PERSON attained the age of majority on DATE proceedings concerning the applicant ’s renewed request to be granted access to S. were pending in ORG .

Likewise , the applicant ’s motion lodged in DATE to withdraw or restrict Ms PERSON right of custody in order to prevent her from moving abroad for DATE with PERSON and her family was dismissed . The national courts found that there were no indications that there were risks for the child ’s well - being which could justify an interference with Ms B .- K. ’s right of custody . The applicant ’s motion lodged in DATE to be granted joint custody of PERSON was equally rejected .
CARDINAL joint applications ( nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) concerning the said access and custody matters are pending with this ORG .

On DATE the ORG declared inadmissible PERSON PERSON ’s application no . ORG concerning the change of PERSON ’s surname after PERSON GPE ’s marriage and compensation for financial losses because of an undue refusal of access .

On DATE the applicant lodged a request with ORG partly to withdraw Ms B .- K. ’s custody of S. in order to secure the preparation of an expert report in the access proceedings pending in ORG since DATE . He also applied for interim measures to be taken .

On DATE the GPE ( ORG dismissed the applicant ’s motion for bias against ORG judge S. It found that there were no indications whatsoever that the judge challenged was biased . On DATE the GPE ( ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objections against its decision .

On DATE ORG conducted a hearing attended by the applicant and S. ’s guardian ad litem . It imposed a coercive penalty of CARDINAL Deutschmarks on Ms B .- K. for failure to attend the hearing . It suspended the proceedings in order to await the outcome of the access proceedings pending in ORG .

On DATE the GPE ( ORG , following the applicant ’s and Ms B .- K. ’s appeals , quashed ORG order against Ms B .- K. to pay a coercive penalty for failure to attend the hearing because of a formal mistake . The applicant ’s objections against this decision were to no avail .
On DATE the GPE ( ORG quashed the decision of ORG ordering the suspension of the proceedings .
On DATE the GPE ( ORG , on the applicant ’s appeal , ordered ORG to further the proceedings .

On DATE the ORG fixed a date for S. ’s hearing on DATE . The date for the hearing was then postponed until DATE . On DATE the GPE ( ORG dismissed as inadmissible the applicant ’s appeal against the fixing of the dates for a hearing , as no appeal lay against these orders .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s further motion for bias against ORG judge S. as ill - founded . It found that the judge ’s conduct of the proceedings disclosed no indications of bias on her part . The applicant ’s objections were to no avail .
On DATE the GPE ( ORG , endorsing the reasons given by ORG , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against ORG decision of DATE .

On DATE ORG refused to admit the applicant ’s constitutional complaint ( CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL ) against the decisions of ORG and the GPE ( ORG concerning the applicant ’s motions for bias against ORG judge LOC and the length of the proceedings .
On DATE S. attained the age of majority . At that time , the proceedings in ORG had not yet been terminated .

In previous proceedings brought by the applicant ( CARDINAL F CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , the GPE ( ORG found on CARDINAL July CARDINAL that the applicant was entitled to obtain certain information about his son ’s development . Ms B .- K. was ordered to inform him about the type of school which S. attended , his class and his results , his interests in sports and music and any serious diseases , and to give him a recent photograph of his son . The applicant ’s requests for further information were dismissed .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s renewed request dated DATE ( CARDINAL F CARDINAL/CARDINAL RE ) for information on S. ’s personal situation . It argued that the applicant had received conclusive information about his son ’s personal situation following his previous requests .
On DATE the applicant lodged a motion with ORG to be granted access to the files of the Schwalm - Eder - District Youth Office concerning his son S.

On DATE ORG ( CARDINAL E CARDINAL ) dismissed the applicant ’s motion as inadmissible . It found that the applicant had inspected the entire case - files in DATE and therefore had no legitimate interest in being granted access again .

On DATE ORG refused to admit the applicant ’s constitutional complaints ( nos . CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) against decisions concerning the applicant ’s request for access to his son and a request lodged in DATE for information about his son ’s development . It imposed a fine of MONEY ( ORG ) respectively for abuse of petition on the applicant .
On DATE ORG informed the applicant that the court had decided not to modify its decision of DATE .
